subject: Affiliate offer from FutureFlower
custom_intro: I just listened to the Monica episode. Interesting hearing an atheist's perspective on AA. Didn't realise secular meetings were a thing.
podcast_name: An All Night Place - Secular AA
latest_episode_description: In this deeply personal episode, Monica joins us from Chicago to share her lived experience of long-term sobriety through secular recovery. Speaking candidly as a dual-diagnosed atheist, Monica reflects on more than a decade of struggle with alcoholism, drug-resistant bipolar depression, anxiety, repeated relapses, homelessness, and a near-fatal crisis that became a turning point in her life.She traces her journey from years of trying to make traditional recovery models work, through discovering the world of secular recovery during the COVID era, and ultimately building a sustainable, life-saving path that works for her. Monica speaks openly about Intensive Outpatient Programs, electroconvulsive therapy, alternative 12-step approaches, SMART Recovery, Recovery Dharma, atheist and agnostic AA spaces, and the importance of choice in recovery.This episode is also about connection. Monica shares how service, volunteering, community, and staying out of isolation have been essential to maintaining her sobriety. She offers thoughtful encouragement to newcomers, people who have relapsed, and those who are sober-curious, reminding us that recovery is not one-size-fits-all and that showing up matters more than perfection.A powerful, compassionate conversation about persistence, honesty, secular support, and why itâ€™s never too late to find what finally sticks.

subject: What do you think of this?
custom_intro: I just listened to the female friendships episode. The part about making friends as an adult being so hard really resonated with me.
podcast_name: Life As We See It with A and A
latest_episode_title: Dynamics of female friendships - Making friends, breakups & setting boundaries
latest_episode_description: We discuss the dynamics of female friendship in this episode. I am joined back again by my friend Enuma to share the importance and dynamics of female friendships. She shared her experience with her friend groups, what she looks out for in a friend, how she has become a better friend as she's grown older/matured especially around setting and respecting her friend's boundaries. We talked about deal breakers and red flags in friendships and signs of a good or bad friend. Making friends as an adult is particularly difficult especially when you're introverted but can be worth it when you find your tribe. We talked about how friendships can be cultural where different cultures e.g. Americans don't easily warm up to you even though you think they are your friends. If you are someone looking to make new friends or learn more about female friendship dynamics, this episode is for you. Hope you enjoyed watching it. Pls Like, Comment, Share and Subscribe #friends #friendship #femalefriendships #bestfriends #friendshipchallenges Please Subscribe and watch our YouTube channel: @LifeAsWeSeeItPodcast

subject: Thoughts on this?
custom_intro: I just listened to the identity theft episode. The Daniel and Babylon analogy was a good one.
latest_episode_title: Identity Theft: Recovering the Self the World Stole - The Parliament Raven Season 7 Ep6
latest_episode_description: The world is constantly trying to rename you, just like Babylon tried to rename Daniel and every label it offers pulls you further from your God-given identity. In this episode, we unpack why modern culture is obsessed with identity performance and how that obsession leaves believers spiritually disoriented and unrooted. Drawing from Daniel and Ephesians, we explore why identity confusion is spiritual warfare, not self-discovery, and how renewing the mind is really about reclaiming who God already named you to be. This is a call to reject counterfeit labels, resist modern Babylon, and recover the identity that no algorithm, culture, or trauma can steal.Find On Apple, Spotify, and Pandora PodcastsWebsite: https://www.theparliamentraven.comPatreaon: https://www.patreon.com/cw/TheParliamentRaven Merch: https://theparliamentraven.myshopify.com/
